abstract.text: A swift abstraction for defining types of data commonly rendered within a Graphical User Interface (GUI). This package provides
the means to define, validate, and relate different forms of data.

inlineContent.text: You may depend on this package by using the
package as a dependency in your package manifest.

code: // The swift-tools-version declares the minimum version of Swift required to build this package.
// Products define the executables and libraries a package produces, and make them visible to other packages.
// Dependencies declare other packages that this package depends on.

// Targets can depend on other targets in this package, and on products in packages this package depends on.

abstract.text: Protocol for specifying Dictionary types. This protocol is used to
conform generics to Dictionaries.
Container for storing validation functions for values specified with a Path.
SchemaAttribute defines a label, type, and validation rules for an Attribute.
This document provides an overview of the different attribute types available to the developer.
Provides methods for modifying a path such as appending path components and changing the root
of the path.
A Text Property.
An EnumerableCollection Property.
A simple interface for chaining together different validators. This factory can be reused to create a
validator that may perform the task of several validators chained together. This factory will
store a function to generate a complex validation rule that can be modified/altered to work with
other validators. When the user is satisfied with the validation rule, this factory may be used
to generate the validator as many times as required by using the
function.
A trigger that removes a field when fired.
This trigger adds a field and attribute value to an object when triggered.
A Bool Property.
A
for defining multiple validators.
Provide helper properties for Optional types.
Path to a value that can only be read and written to.
Path that points to values that can be read and written to.
A Code property.
This tutorial demonstrates how to create a schema for a simple Person view. This guide will also introduce the methods of creating
validators and triggers for a view hierarchy.
A property wrapper for defining groups of attributes.
All types of Attributes. An attribute is a way of grouping common data
types.
A type-erased SearchablePath.
This section describes the validators that are available in the
module.
This protocol provides the bare-minimum implementation for a group of attributes
that can be validated, triggered, and displayed. An instance of this protocol
represents the types of attributes accessible through this interface. Additionally,
this protocol defines the validators required for each attribute and all the attributes
as a whole. A similar requirement is placed on the triggers, where an instance may define a
trigger that reacts to target attributes within this protocol.
The supported types for a BlockAttribute.
Provides a common means of accessing and mutating data represented using attributes.
A trigger that initiates another trigger when a specific value is changed. This
trigger will monitor a value through a path and initiate a trigger function when the
value changes.
A Type-Erased version of types conforming to
Provides functions for searching a path for sub-paths that exist between the Root and
Value pointed to by the path.
A struct that represents a single column in a table. Each column is represented using a
A group of common attributes. This struct can be used to represent a group
of attributes. These attributes can be made available/unavailable (shown or not shown
in an editor) or you can perform CRUD operations.
An Expression property.
ValidationError is an error that occurs when validating.
A validator that requires values to be present (not nil) for a validation rule.
Path to a value that can only be read and never mutated.
Attributes that contain other attribute types or fill a block pattern.
A Line Property.
Path for pointing to members that are read-only.
An Enumerated Property.
This guide presents the triggers that are available to the user by default.
A trigger that overwrites a target value from a source value by using a transformation function.
This trigger will be enacted when the source value changes. Once the source value is changed,
this trigger will fire causing an update in the target value by using the transform function.
This guide provides an overview of the Attributes package regarding the different features available
to developers.
A trigger that can be customised to perform a function when triggered.
A data container for holding errors specific to a set of related Paths.
Label is a String by default.
A struct for holding a
, which is an AttributeType and a label.
Protocol for defining a validation function that can be enacted on a Root object.
A container storing a read-only path.
Property wrapper that defines type information for a collection attribute
where the elements are complex attributes. Each element within the collection
must contain the same form equivalent to type information defined in an
instance of
. This type information forms the
of
this property wrapper.
Performs a validator for values pointed to by a
A type-erased validator.
Path to a value containing validation rules.
A useful utility struct that enables quick testing of modifiable
structs that use an attributes and meta data array.
A property wrapper that defines type information for a complex attribute. This struct
acts as a wrapper around a
type that defines that type information
for a complex attribute.
NullObject version of Schema.
Trigger definition. A Trigger represent a type that performs some function in response to an event
that occurs in some other part of the system. The Trigger contains a
function
that mutates a root object. Different Trigger may perform different actions by implementing
the
method in different ways. The TriggerProtocol also requires a helper
method called
that allows querying of whether a trigger is enacted
when a variable changes (as represented with a
A property that represents a collection. A collection is used to define an array of one specific
attribute.
A Code type which is a String by default.
A trigger that updates a target value with a source value when that source value changes.
Validator that performs validation only when the value is not nil. A nil value does not throw
any errors during a validation. For a validator that throws errors for nil values, see
A LineAttribute is an Attribute that is represented without any relation
to other Attributes.
A protocol for defining an
that represents data using a
. This protocol allows a cleaner implementation by providing default
paths to the respective complex data (both fields and values). To implement
this protocol, the user need only provide a container that stores the data
and the path to the complex attribute stored within it by setting the
property of the conforming type. Once these paths are set up, the user
must provide the properties within the complex attribute as local properties
of the conforming type using the property wrappers for the respective attributes.
A Type-erased trigger.
This protocol provides a mechanism for chaining different validators together into a
single validator that can perform a single validation function. This protocol also
forms a basis for defining common validation function such as validating that
collections arenâ€™t empty, or that collections have a specific amount of elements, etc.
Struct for checking whether paths point to values containing errors.
A trigger that performs no function.
A
for defining multiple Triggers.
A trigger that only executes when a condition is true.
Provides the means to perform validations using
s. This protocol
allows the dynamic allocation of validation functions to members existing within a root
object by using a key path.
An Integer Property.
The type of any Attribute.
A
for referencing objects within a
. This path
stores a root path to the collection and an element path from the Collection element to
the value. The
can recursively use both of these paths to generate
valid key paths inside a root objects collection.
A property that represents data in a table.
A Float Property.
A swift abstraction for defining types of data commonly rendered within a Graphical User Interface (GUI). This package provides
the means to define, validate, and relate different forms of data.
All the possible types of a LineAttribute.
A Path that points to a type-erased quantity within some Root type.
Enum containing supported languages by Attributes.
A trigger that will apply a separate trigger to all elements within a collection.
A schema is the top-level representation of an attribute heirarchy. A schema
contains type information, validators, and triggers for all attributes that
are related. A schema can only contain groups, and you may use the
property wrapper to define the groups within this schema.
A container that stores a writeable path.
A Protocol for representing attributes that are grouped together. This protocol can
be used to group together all types of attributes including block attribute
and line attributes. This protocol will be used in schemas to represent type information
for grouped properties.
Expression is a String by default.
